Package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.rng

Interfaces for random number generation services The package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.rng/code> defines two kinds of random number generation components.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    NormalRNGenerator
    The class NormalRNGenerator implements a component that generates N(0, 1) random numbers and provides this service through a data offered interface called RNGDataOfferedI.
    NormalRNGenerator.DoubleRandomNumber
    The class DoubleRandomNumber define a data object that is exchanged through the component data interfaces.
    UniformRNGenerator
    The class UniformRNGenerator implements a component that generates U(lowerBound, upperBound) random numbers and provides this service through a data offered interface called RNGDataOfferedI.
    UniformRNGenerator.DoubleRandomNumber
    The class IntRandomNumber implements that data interface defined in the data offered interface RNGDataOfferedI that is provided by this component.

Package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.rng Description

Interfaces for random number generation services

The package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.rng/code> defines two kinds of random number generation components. The component UniformRNGenerator generates random numbers from a uniform distribution between lower and an upper bounds lb and up, aka U(lb, ub), while the component NormalRNGenerator generates random numbers from a normal distribution of mean 0 and standard deviation 1, aka N(0,1), using two U(0,1) random numbers.

These components make use of interfaces in the package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.rng.interfaces/code> to offer their service and for their implementation of service methods.
